title: C++ iostream Library (Standard Input / Output Streams)

content.heading: C++ iostream Objects
paragraphs: The <iostream> library provides objects which can read user input and output data to the console or to a file.
A list of commonly used iostream objects is provided below:
- cin: Used for standard input (reading from the keyboard).
- cout: Used for standard output (displaying text on the console).
- cerr: Used for standard error output (displaying error messages).
- clog: Used for logging messages, typically for debugging purposes.
